item.title: vRealize Automation 8.x - vRA Not Starting if K8s IP Range is Changed
item.description: vRealize Automation (vRA) 8.0 introduced a completely new architecture by running the vRA application itself on top of a Kubernetes (k8s) cluster. Unfortunately this was released with a hardcoded IP address range used by the internal k8s cluster. If your corporate network happened to be using the same IP addresses that were selected by the k8s cluster, then you would likely see plenty of errors in vRA. Thankfully, vRealize Automation 8.
